comment.body:
LocateRegistry is used to obtain a reference to a bootstrap remote object registry on a particular host (including the local host), or to create a remote object registry that accepts calls on a specific port.

Note that a getRegistry call does not actually make a connection to the remote host. It simply creates a local reference to the remote registry and will succeed even if no registry is running on the remote host. Therefore, a subsequent method invocation to a remote registry returned as a result of this method may fail. @version 1.33, 12/19/03 @author Ann Wollrath @author Peter Jones @since JDK1.1 @see java.rmi.registry.Registry
